repo.name: eventlet
repo.description: Concurrent networking library for Python

cves.summary: Eventlet affected by HTTP request smuggling in unparsed trailers
Potential DoS via the Tudoor mechanism in eventlet and dnspython
Improper Handling of Highly Compressed Data (Data Amplification) and Memory Allocation with Excessive Size Value in eventlet
Eventlet is a concurrent networking library for Python. A websocket peer may exhaust memory on Eventlet side by sending very large websocket frames. Malicious peer may exhaust memory on Eventlet side

readme.summary: Clear about what the package does and how to install it, but lacks inline examples and only links to external documentation for actual usage.
readme.top_issue: No quick-start code example in the README itself - users must click through to external docs to see any actual code

common_complaints: Exception handling bugs (return in finally swallowing exceptions)
Missing type hints and mypy support
Deprecation warnings not visible to users
Monkey patching compatibility issues with Python 3.13+
praise_themes: Regular release cycle with version bumps
Bug fixes and security patches being addressed
sentiment.summary: Eventlet shows active maintenance with regular releases and bug fixes, but exhibits a pattern of subtle bugs in core functionality and packaging that suggest the codebase may benefit from modernization (type hints, improved testing) to prevent regressions.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2025-12-10)

Zero active contributors in past 6 months
No releases in the tracked period
No open PRs indicating stalled development

concerns: High number of open issues (84) compared to merged PRs in the past 6 months (59)
Low number of closed issues and merged PRs in the past 6 months
positive_signals: Recent activity with a commit on 2026-01-09
Multiple contributors active in the past 6 months (11)
maintenance.summary: The package shows minimal maintenance efforts despite recent commits and multiple contributors.

changelog.summary: The changelog lacks clear marking of breaking changes, migration guides, and proper categorization but appears to be comprehensive.

governance.summary: The project documents the decision-making process but lacks a succession plan and clear contributor ladder, posing medium risk.
